summary: By the same guy who made People Are Strangers...
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/972816-1410102710.png[/img]
[size=1]Or Skyrim Realistic Immersive Doors Overhaul
[/size]
[youtube]VaNXYJrH5aI[/youtube]
[youtube]Laj0R3HLEV8[/youtube]

[size=4]This mod is pretty simple: it removes any text on all doors you might encounter. The only text you can eventually see is [Locked], when the door is locked. This also has the effect of removing any text indicating the level of the lock: no more "Apprentice", etc.
You won't be able to see who's the the owner of which house. You will have to remember that yourself.
[/size]
[size=3]This mod is inspired by my other mod: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56744/?]People Are Strangers[/url].
[/size]
[size=4]Things you should know:[/size]
[list][*][size=3]Is compatible with any mod as far as I know.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Does [i][u][color=#00ff00]NOT[/color][/u][/i] require SKSE.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Only [i][color=#00ff00][u]ONE[/u][/color][/i] script will run only [i][color=#00ff00][u]ONCE[/u][/color][/i] then will [i][u][color=#00ff00]NEVER[/color][/u][/i] run again.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Does not affect the game's performances.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Will affect doors from other mods and DLC's.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Please don't ask if I can add a filter to allow visited places to be shown on doors, the answer is: it would require scripts to almost constantly run on your save. Which is [u][i][color=#00ff00]NOT[/color][/i][/u] the case here.[/size][/*]
[/list]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/ATeYx2X.png[/img]
author: Sagittarius22
